intro: Ageratina amblyolepis, commonly known as the rough ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Ageratina amblyolepis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and blooms.
